pull.title: RPC getinfo,getnetworkinfo: export local node's client sub-version string

events.message: RPC getinfo,getnetworkinfo: export local node's client sub-version string

issue.title: Include version string of version message we send in the debug log
issue.body: Include the version string we are sending to nodes in the debug output.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4914_eadbedfc902305b9ac845f89e15e97742f04b1e2/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
I would rather not extend getinfo anymore.
Yeah, as we deprecated it, we shouldn't extend it. Perhaps somehow flag it deprecated?
ACK on the getnetworkinfo change, NACK on getinfo change. Getinfo only exists for backwards compatibility, please don't change it anymore.
It is inconsistent to export version/clientversion in one place, and version/clientversion/subversion in a second place.

It is, but we've NACKed many changes that added or changed info in getinfo, merging this would also be inconsistent. There are many more of those inconsistencies building up in getinfo output (see for example the testnet boolean). They'll just accrue until we remove the command at some point...

@diapolo as for flagging it deprecated, I'd say this monster note at the top is quite clear:

```
 * @note Do not add or change anything in the information returned by this
 * method. `getinfo` exists for backwards-compatibilty only. It combines
 * information from wildly different sources in the program, which is a mess,
 * and is thus planned to be deprecated eventually.
 *
 * Based on the source of the information, new information should be added to:
 * - `getblockchaininfo`,
 * - `getnetworkinfo` or
 * - `getwalletinfo`
 *
 * Or alternatively, create a specific query method for the information.
```

comments.body: While you are on `getnetworkinfo`, the int casts before CLIENT_VERSION and PROTOCOL_VERSION can be removed :).
